For me it was movie called "On the Beech". If you have never seen it, I highly recommend it. It was about post nuclear war, and it scared the snot out of me. This does not mean horror movie, I find them to be just silly and void of anything other than fake blood and bad acting, I mean real movies about real events. By the way, has anyone seen On the Beech? And if yes, what did you think about it?

post_info.post_title: What was the most frightening movie you ever watched?

The Ring was probably the scariest movie I've ever seen.
 
 I looked up reviews of "On the Beach". I think the movie was meant to discourage war and therefore sounds like it exaggerates how bad nuclear war is. To have everyone dead from a nuclear war is pretty hard to believe although I guess it is theoretically possible.
 
 My favorite nuclear war movies are Sum of All Fears and Deterrence (US vs Iraq).
 
 This thread sparked my memory. I can't believe I found this website back but I think you will really enjoy this little movie review of a movie titled Threads. I've never seen the movie but simply reading the summary of the movie makes for a great read!
 
 http://www.ibp-intl.demon.co.uk/nuke/threads.html

The Blair Witch Project was the scariest movie I have seen. Even that wasn't really scary but still...
 
 I thought the Ring was pretty lame.
 
 House of 1,000 Corpses is by far the most disturbing movie I have ever seen.

I also just looked at reviews for On the Beach, and I did not know that it had been done in 1959. I saw the 2000 version, probably right after it came out. I will have to look for the older version of it to make a nice comparison. It did not seem to have an unrealistic portrayal of nuclear war, it actually seemed very realistic...perhaps a little too realistic.

For me, the most frightening (or rather 'shocking') were:
 
 a) Eyewitness (starring Mark Lester)
 b) The Island (with Michael Caine)
 c) Alien
 d) Terminator
 
 
 Growing-up watching films, the captain was always the hero who pulled the team through. In Alien, he's one of the first to get killed. This spun me out.
 
 In a similar fashion, when the Terminator goes to town by blasting away cop after cop in the police station, I was stunned and numbed.
 
 Eyewitness and The Island too feature some scenes where you don't expect someone to be killed.
The Exorcist than I met the real Satan and realized the human mind could only touch a small fraction of his essence
lost highway or really, any david lynch movie. none of that 'poping out of nowhere' scare, but the creepy and strange visuals and ideas in his movies. this is true fright.

The Exorcist than I met the real Satan and realized the human mind could only touch a small fraction of his essence

 
 That's not even debatable... people are possessed very often. Christ even exorcised demons out of people, as well as the APostles.

I would go with
 
 1) The Omen
 2) A clockwork Orange
 3) Soylent Green
 4) Sybil (Real and makes you wonder if it could happen to you)

'a clockwork orange' is an art movie and probably my favorite movie of all time. i don't consider it scary though.
 
 'the omen' was pretty scary though.
 
 you want disturbing? try 'cannibal holocaust', but don't expect to find it in blockbuster. for movies such as this, i go to a place called 'the black lodge'.
I thought Signs was pretty frightening. The mood of the movie was just quiet and then suddenly you hear like loud sounds out of nowhere, which scared the living daylights out of me.
I got bored with A Clockword Orange.

I got bored with A Clockword Orange.

 that is an insult of the utmost kind directed, indirectly, at me. ;)
the exorcist for sure! i saw it when i was 14 ill never see it again!

[FONT=comic sans ms]Well for me the scariest film I hav ever watched is.....................................................Disneys Snow White....what wuz up wiv the singin & that witch wuz pretty scary!nah but seriously i havent watched a film that has scary.Exorcist = funny, blair witch = Lame, the ring = original wuz good the other one was not! the list goes on, can anyone recommend me a very scary film? [/FONT]

The Exorcist than I met the real Satan and realized the human mind could only touch a small fraction of his essence

 
 You actually met Satan?

I did think the Ring was not so great of a movie but it still scared me and so did SEVEN cuz that guys creeeeeeeeepy and then THEY is the kind of movie where stuff jumps out at u i actually screemed in the theatre......... 4 times lol i never do that either...

I have yet to see the Exorcist, but so far the scariest movie that I've seen is the Ring, for sure. A friend and I went to see it, and he isn't the type to get scared really easily, but even he did then!
 
 Some of you don't think it was really scary?

I have yet to see the Exorcist, but so far the scariest movie that I've seen is the Ring, for sure. A friend and I went to see it, and he isn't the type to get scared really easily, but even he did then!

 you should see the exorcist it scared me and im 36 years old!

You actually met Satan?

 
 
 
 
 Yes......he came to tempt me, offering ...beauty, fame, fortune, power, worldly goods..

you should see the exorcist it scared me and im 36 years old!

 
 Well, one of these days when I feel liked being scared out of my wits, I watch it then. ;)

Yes......he came to tempt me, offering ...beauty, fame, fortune, power, worldly goods..

 okay...did someone forget to take their medication jk jk ;)

Yes......he came to tempt me, offering ...beauty, fame, fortune, power, worldly goods..

 
 What kind of clothes did he have on? The only reason I ask, this "little girl" came to my house the other day and told me she was selling cookies. Now, I thought something seemed suspicious about her, and I am pretty sure that under that cute little green hat I saw horns, I can't be sure, but I think they were horns. She also tried to tempt me with things called "thin mints" and "trefoils" (these obviously must be some evil spawn of satan designed to draw us to his kingdom). She even tried to tell me that by buying some of these "cookies", I would be helping her troop (evil hordes of little devilish minions spawned in hell) to go on a trip to Hawaii (obviously the next stop on the satan world tour). So I thought to myself, what would Rapture do? Well, you will be proud to know that I grabbed my cross and held it out to her screaming "be gone satan...away from my door you tempting demon." She ran from my house screaming that she would never return. I thank you Rapture, as your continuous warnings about satan probably saved me from eternal damnation. 
 
 PS: Does anyone know when those damn girlscouts come around, I could sure use some of those yummy cookies?
ill bet he looked alot like jerry fallwel ,a wolf in sheeps clothing

I'd have to say it was a tie between 'The Ring' and "Rose Red'

 
 Vertical Limit. Indesputable.
 
 Remember the beginning of the movie.... The two kids above fly down the mountain past them and their buckles break... The pegs start popping out of the wall. the father, son, and daughter are hanging by the daughters last peg. The father is yelling at the son to cut the rope and let him fall, or they're all going to die. 
 
 The camera zooms out to a panorama of the entire mountain, peaceful and serene.... THEN WHAM!!!! DAD'S BODY SLAMS INTO THE GROUND!!!
 
 That was a scary fricken movie.
 
 
 
 Lev
Oh i hated what i saw of that movie its not that it was scary just kinda gross...like when sh breaks her finger and they snap it back into place *cringes* eeeeeeeeeeeewwwwwwwwwwwwwwww!

Master of Disguise, the only time I have ever feared for my immortal soul is while watching that 'film'.

Not sure if it made it to the states (was a UK film) in a big way but it is good (England is far better as a post apocalyptic place, rain, fog, mud and ruins from a previously dead age is far bleaker than deserts)
